journal-meta.journal-title: The International Journal of Robotics Research

title-group.article-title: Opportunities and challenges with autonomous micro aerial vehicles

contrib-group.aff: University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, PA, USA

author-notes.corresp: Vijay Kumar, University of Pennsylvania, 220 South 33rd Street, Philadelphia, PA 19104-6315, USA. Email: kumar@grasp.upenn.edu

article-meta.issue-title: Special Issue on The Fifteenth International Symposium on Robotics Research, 2011

abstract.p: We survey the recent work on micro unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), a fast-growing field in robotics, outlining the opportunities for research and applications, along with the scientific and technological challenges. Micro-UAVs can operate in three-dimensional environments, explore and map multi-story buildings, manipulate and transport objects, and even perform such tasks as assembly. While fixed-base industrial robots were the main focus in the first two decades of robotics, and mobile robots enabled most of the significant advances during the next two decades, it is likely that UAVs, and particularly micro-UAVs, will provide a major impetus for the next phase of education, research, and development.
